servinfo.title: DTC P2122: Pedal Position Sensor (Main) Circuit Low Input

entry.ptxt: Ground of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor for shield wire

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Output voltage of accelerator pedal position sensor (main) is less than 0.2 V for 0.5 seconds continuously.

item.ptxt: Incorrect mounting of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC using scan tool.
Keep the accelerator pedal at idle position for 2 seconds.
Keep the accelerator pedal at fully depressed position for 2 seconds.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions for DTC Troubleshooting:For Petrol Engine Model .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 2.
Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check:For Petrol Engine Model

testgroup.title: Accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly mounting check

test1.ptxt: Check that accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly has been mounted to vehicle body properly (no pinched floor carpet, etc).

testgroup.question: Is it OK?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 3.
Reinstall accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly properly referring to Accelerator Pedal Position (APP) Sensor Assembly Removal and Installation:For Petrol Engine Model .

testgroup.title: Accelerator pedal position sensor (main) and its circuit check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ON ignition switch, check “APP Sensor 1 Volt” displayed on scan tool.

testgroup.question: Is displayed voltage below 0.1 V?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 4.

paragroup.ptxt: Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection to accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly at “WHT”, “WHT/BLU” and “ORN” wire terminals.
If OK, measure voltage between “WHT” wire terminal of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly connector and vehicle body ground with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 5.

test1.ptxt: Turn OFF ignition switch.
Remove ECM from its bracket with ECM connectors connected.
Check for proper connection of ECM connector at “E23-56” terminal.
If OK, measure voltage between “E23-56” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: “WHT” wire is open or high resistance circuit.
Go to Step 6.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure resistance between “E23-56” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground.

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
“WHT” wire is shorted to ground circuit.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection of ECM connector at “E23-55”, “E23-54” and “E23-51” terminals.
If OK, measure resistance between “WHT/BLU” wire terminal of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly connector and vehicle body ground.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 8.
“WHT/BLU” wire is shorted to ground circuit.

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance between “E23-55” and each “E23-54”, “E23-51” terminals of ECM connector with ignition switch turned OFF.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 9.
“WHT/BLU” wire is shorted to “ORN ” wire and/or “BLU/YEL” wire circuit.

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance between “WHT/BLU” wire terminal of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly connector and “E23-55” terminal of ECM connector with ignition switch turned OFF.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 10.
“WHT/BLU” wire is open or high resistance circuit.

test1.ptxt: Connect connectors to ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure resistance between “ORN” wire terminal of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly connector and vehicle body ground.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 12.
Go to Step 11.

test1.ptxt: Remove ECM from its bracket with ECM connectors connected.
Check for proper connection of ECM connector at “E23-54” terminal.
If OK, measure resistance between “E23-54” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground.

action.ptxt: “ORN” wire is open or high resistance circuit.
Faulty ECM ground circuit. If circuit is OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

testgroup.title: Accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly check

test1.ptxt: Check accelerator pedal position sensor (main) referring to Accelerator Pedal Position (APP) Sensor Assembly Removal and Installation:For Petrol Engine Model .

testgroup.question: Is output voltage within specified value?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
Replace accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly.
